text: Hewlett-Packard CEO Mark Hurd believes that the $ 13 billion acquisition of Electronic Data Systems will help build out HP's enterprise services offerings and "accelerate '' the company's reach into new accounts, he said. In a May 20 conference call with reporters to announce HP's 2008 second-quarter financial earnings, Hurd offered his thoughts on the upcoming acquisition of EDS. While Hurd could not say when the deal would close, he noted that HP is already looking at ways to integrate its software and services portfolio with EDS' business. Hurd implied that HP will streamline costs to make the acquisition profitable for shareholders as soon as possible. Several analysts have said they believe that HP, through its acquisition of EDS and other companies, is looking to build a services division that will create an all-in-one shop for building state-of-the art data centers.
title: Hewlett-Packard's CEO says he believes the EDS acquisition will make the company's service offerings stronger.
